intro: Lisianthius quichensis, commonly known as the Quiché lisianthus, is a flowering plant native to the highland regions of Guatemala. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats at elevations above 2,000 meters. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color, with narrow, linear leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
